result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy D Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civi ljudgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant follow all Children's Court and BMCW orders as it pertains to contact with the child.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon and under the domestic violence law he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy D Wilson

records.addlTxt:
As to Count 1 as amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 37 months in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 65 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 13 months and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months with the following conditions:

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court ordered that the defendant follow all Children's Court and BMCW orders as it pertains to contact with the child. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon and under the domestic violence law he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Randy D Wilson in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Randy D Wilson in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial however, the parties have reached a resolution.
Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, the Court ordered the repeater enhancer dismissed. 

As to Count 1 as amended:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Letter from the State received and filed.

Received and filed:
State's Witness List.
State's motion in limine.
State's requested jury instructions.
Notice of Expert Testimony.
cab

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Randy D Wilson not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Abbey Marie DeSiato.
cab
Motion in Limine filed by the defense.
Parties may want to resolve this case prior to the trial date.  Parties were informed to contact the court for a date, if needed.
Jury trial remains calendared for 11/04/2015 at 08:30 a.m., in Branch 36.
Count 2 and 3 severed from Count 1.  CCAP case modified to reflect same.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Randy D Wilson not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The parties are in court for a scheduling conference.
Received and filed:
Notice to Offer Video-Recorded Interview of Child.
The court was informed that the first charge on this case is a domestic violence charge, the other 2 counts are drug charges.
Defense filed a motion to sever count 1 from counts 2 and 3.  The state informs that they will not object to it but they are not quite sure how to accomplish this.  After speaking with the Clerk of Court's Office, the court ordered count 1 severed from counts 2 and 3.  The Clerk of Courts Office will be creating a new court file for the 2 drug counts.
.
As to count 1 the defense is asking for a transcript of the interview from the state.  Court did not grant the request.
.
Later the same day, the Clerk of Court's Office notified the court that the new case number for the drug charges is 15CF002775.  The case is assigned to Judge Stark's Court.  Next court date is 09/02/2015 at 01:30 p.m. in her court.
.
Court ordered that the $7,500 bail ordered on this case is to be modified to $3750.00 on each case.
.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randy D Wilson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Randy D Wilson in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Harris informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney Harris is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 7-15-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Randy D Wilson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Randy D Wilson in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:Bradley Kwiatkowski-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  (Scheduling Date is requested by Defense Counsel.)  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail received and filed.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RW dob 9/22/11; Princess A or Heather G.

Defendant Randy D Wilson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Randy D Wilson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
